column4: Hello mine is an AMD Turion 64 bit machine with 32 bit windows vista loaded. What would you recommend me to do ? Install the 32 bit or 64 bit version of Ubuntu ?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SrWqKbqDQpU (I have not checked the accuracy of the instructions in this video, but I assume they're good).
Just finished the video and I can confirm that the instructions are all correct (and though the video shows dual booting with XP, it's exactly the same with Vista).
See it uses the first option - install side by side - I am using the 3rd option manual partitioning just to make sure my recovery partition of HDD doesn't get overwritten
Go with the install side by by side option, it leaves no room for human error :)

Last time somebody told me ubuntu "forgot" to install my GRUB and it happens once in a while... This was when after my installation it would boot straight into VISTA without even showing the ubuntu option ..  it almost shattered my notion of using a computer :)

The video makes it look as its open and shut thing.. :) Dunno how good the experience would be after a few months as WUBI just stopped working one fine day .... Thats the mystery that I just can't seem to solve

Thank you for you inputs for the Ubuntu 10.10 installation yesterday. I am finally on it...  Its good But the windows in Ubuntu seems to be flying all over the place unlike Vista which seems more disciplined
You're welcome. What do you mean by "flying all over the place"?

Sorry I lost you. The FF froze :). What I meant was the dialog boxes opened are not over the ones from where it was opened . I sometimes find it below the pile of opened windows especially the empathy window. login on one window and talk on another which is somewhere down, Each tabs on FF gives an icon on the taskbar...
It's your router that is preventing access from the internet.
See http://portforward.com/ for instructions on configuring your router for port forewarding.
:  thanks I will have a look
